term.title: liquid-liquid extraction

item.text: This term may be used in place of liquid-liquid distribution when the emphasis is on the analyte(s) being distributed (or extracted).

notes.item: The distinction between the distribution constant (KD) and the partition constant (KDo) or the concentration distribution ratio  (Dc) is reaffirmed and it is recommended that the terms partition constant, partition coefficient and extinction constant should not be used as synonyms for the (analytical) distribution ratio (in liquid-liquid distribution), Dc. A distinction is drawn between the terms solvent and diluent, and the term extractant (in liquid-liquid distribution) is now restricted to the active substance in the solvent (i.e. the homogeneous 'organic phase' which comprises the extractant (in liquid-liquid distribution), the diluent and/or the modifier) which is primarily responsible for the transfer of solute from the 'aqueous' to the 'organic' phase.

term.citation: Citation: 'liquid-liquid extraction' in IUPAC Compendium of Chemical Terminology, 5th ed. International Union of Pure and Applied Chemistry; 2025. Online version 5.0.0, 2025. 10.1351/goldbook.L03587

Users of these terms are encouraged to include the version of a term with its use and to check regularly for updates to term definitions that you are using.
